page.title: 01GAZETTEER DUNLOP
page.content: DUNLOP IS SITUATED IN THE DISTRICT OF KILMARNOCK AND LOUDON IN THE EXTREME NORTH OF AYRSHIRE BORDERING ON RENFREWSHIRE, IN STRATHCLYDE REGION.IT STANDS 400 TO 450 METRES ABOVE SEA _ LEVEL .DUNLOP HAS MAINLY INTENSELY MANAGED GRASSLAND WITH A LITTLE ENCLOSED ROUGH GRAZING. THE TREES ROUND DUNLOP ARE MAINLY DECIDUOUS.THE FARMING IN DUNLOP IS MAINLY DAIRY WITH SOME DIVERSIFYING INTO FATTENING CATTLE AND SHEEP. THE LAND IS USED FOR HAY OR SILAGE. THERE IS NO PLOUGHED LAND FOR CROPS ETC. THE VILLAGE HAS A FAIRLY SPREAD OUT HOUSING AREA WITH THE USUAL SMALL VILLAGE AMENITES ALTHOUGH IT IS UNUSUAL TO HAVE BOTH A BANK AND POST OFFICE.DUNLOP ALSO HAS AN AGRICULTURAL SUPPLIER CALLED HOWIES WHICH EMPLOYS MANY VILLAGERS. AT THE BOTTOM OF MAIN STREET STANDS DUNLOP KIRK.
